title: Actualization through assertion
creator_credit: Research Press, Larry King, Robert Liberman and Barnett Addis
brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression, voice tone and volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applid to situations in client’s daily lives.
